DemocraSEE is platform that incentivizes Civic engagement. It is also a resource and virtual advocate for local government participation and activity. This is a gamified civic experience.

+ family activities (like Family Film and Panel)

a sophisticated Ai that filters expert advise through an algorithm developed to improve health and mindfulness of individuals and organizations. We are dedicated to serving the marginalized communities in our country to mitigate the public health issues at hand.

experiences.title: Head of Wellness Innovations
experiences.description:
Nola is the "Siri for your wellbeing," with daily plans compiled from multiple happiness and health specialists. 

HOW DO I CHOOSE "HAPPY" BEHAVIORS? 

With help from dozens of specialists in all areas of emotional and physical well-being, we've compiled daily plans for "happy" behaviors across four categories of holistic health. 

Nola (an AI) learns your needs and lifestyle and pull from these four categories to make a daily plan. That way, you know what actions will help you have the most fulfilling day.

experiences.title: Creative Director
experiences.description:
Models Doing More (MDM) is a non-profit organization dedicated to placing ‘Model Ambassadors’ in the field and at the center of third world countries. It is also a digital initiative to collaborate with other nonprofits and promote transparency for donors and volunteers. 

MDM follows the lives of ‘Model Ambassadors’ who are giving back to the international community. Models Doing More is dedicated to providing education, assistance, and sustainability to our most vulnerable global neighbors. MDM actively PARTNERS with grassroots organizations to develop long-term educational, medical, and emotional support for disadvantaged children and animals.

volunteer_work.title: Commissioner
volunteer_work.description:
The Human Relations Commission develops positive human relations through education, encouragement of greater respect and understanding between people, their equal opportunity rights under the law and the recognition of the racial, ethnic, religious and cultural diversity of the El Cerrito community.

The purpose of the Human Relations Commission (HRC) is to initiate educational and cultural programs, promote tolerance and mutual respect between all persons. When requested by the City Council, the Commission will evaluate and make recommendations regarding discrimination charges levied against the City, upon the direction of the council. Commission members shall be generally representative of the demographics of the City including the racial, religious, age, gender, ethnic, and other groups. 
http://www.el-cerrito.org/106/Human-Relations-Commission

volunteer_work.title: Advisor
volunteer_work.description:
www.yogamission.uk
The Yoga Mission is a charitable organization running educational projects in three regions of India: Varanasi, Uttarkhand and Madhya Pradesh. Our main base is in Varanasi, where it runs three educational projects. Varanasi is a city situated in Uttar Pradesh, which is one of four Indian states which the UN has declared to be poorer than the 40 poorest African countries added together.

The Yoga Mission does not simply provide children with literacy skills: we offer a stable, nurturing environment for children who, for many reasons, are in need. An alarming report by UNESCO recently concluded that 90% of Indian children are illiterate, even those who attend state-run schools. Girls are the most likely to miss out on an education, and our mission is to reverse this trend by employing a largely female staff in order to offer a safe and non-threatening learning environment to female pupils. This has the added benefit of providing jobs for local women (many of them former pupils themselves) so that they can support themselves, while being able to pay for their own further education.

In the city, by taking children off the streets and offering them stability and education, we show them the way out of the poverty trap, changing not only their lives, but all those around them. In this way we are improving the community one child at a time. In rural areas we aim to work from within the community for sustainable development based on ancient traditions, leading to conscious living, empowerment of women and education.

Real education is about bringing the knowledge out from within.

We work with underprivileged children in rural and inner city areas, using educational methods rooted in ancient traditions for sustainable and conscious living. We are currently involved with projects in Varanasi in Uttar Pradesh, Chitrakoot in Madhya Pradesh and near Mussorie in Uttarkand.

recommendations:
Diana Cantú-Reyna, BSN, RN, CCRN



We are so grateful to have Indy Rishi
Singh as part of the Cultivating Self family. He consistently demonstrates true commitment and unwavering dedication to fulfilling our mission in supporting the mental, physical, and spiritual health of frontline caregivers across the nation. I admire his ability to problem solve especially through some of the greatest challenges - he is constantly thinking “outside of the box” with a high level creative solutions. Indy is a role model to us all and exemplary in his work ethic and integrity - this statement holds a lot of weight as nurses like myself come from the most trusted profession and simply being around his huge heart and playful energy makes even the most daunting tasks quite fun.

Indy’s extensive background in modalities such as: mindfulness, meditation, Ayurveda, conflict resolution, and hypnotherapy just to name a few, have served not only our community of caregivers, but us on the CS team. I have personally been fortunate to witness his magic in real time, touching the hearts of all who meet him and transforming the lives of those lucky enough to learn from him. 

In addition to serving on the Board of Directors, Indy is a Cultivating Self lead facilitator and co-producer for all well-being retreats and has created life-changing experiences for hundreds of attendees. He embodies what is missing in the world, true selfless service. Anyone on a team with Indy should consider themselves fortunate to source his wisdom and be ready for loads of laughter!

Awab Shawkat



Wow - dynamism and adaptibility only begin to explain the facilitative expertise of Indy Rishi Singh! The Quell Foundation was privelleged to have Indy as a copanelist on a lecture regarding social media addiction and non-pharmocolgical and community methods of mental health intervention. Indy had more than a few 'try-it-yourselves' to engage our Zoom audience and his non-linear pedagogy matched perfectly with the tenor of our event. I am still floored by Indy's skill to weave clinical research, restorative justice, cosmological sciences, and his personal experiences into a very compelling and enriching tapestry for his audience to partake in. The Quell Foundation would be delighted to have Indy back any time!

Christina Weber



Indy is a force of nature in the best kind of way. His ability to think critically and lead inclusively are rare traits. He asks the deepest of questions and keeps his ego in check. Indy will gladly sweep the floor and lead the army all at the same time. He shows up for civic duty as a volunteer time and time again. I’ve had the opportunity to work with him directly through WeDeepen. His podcast Political Hope is one of the top-listened to shows on the network. He enrolls the most interesting guests. Definitely listen to the show!

Richard Foster-Fletcher 🌎



I had the very great pleasure of being interviewed by Indy for his podcast. I formed the impression that he is remarkable, acutely reflective and right on the button for what changes are needed in society and leadership. I enjoyed and valued our conversation greatly and plan to seek ways to collaborate and support his work.

Ramon Govea



As a Commercial Producer & Director, I was casting a commercial for a client and really wanted to bring in some authentic positive energy for the Client's big moment, as we worked to define their brand.  So, I immediately thought of Indy who, despite his consummate professionalism, is very much an uplifting "smiling Buddha" archetype when he is working with a group. 

He even brought his flute to set and we were able to capture some great impromptu moments before we wrapped for the day. He brought his A-game, was a very attentive listener, took direction well, and had no ego about the work.  Definitely a great team player and uplifting presence on set and in front of the camera!

Marcela Denniston, CISSP



Indy is an incredible teacher and thought leader who brings both intellect and imagination to every aspect of his work. His creative approaches to integrating science and spiritual knowledge into every aspect of his teaching makes learning with Indy not only easy and fun, but also refreshing. He takes concepts that would normally be mundane and very rigid, and applies innovative methods to keep his audience engaged and involved. Everyone has fun at Indy's classes! Indy can make even the most uptight person crack a smile! 

But most importantly, you can truly see the passion and motivation behind everything Indy works on. I highly recommend Indy's courses and events to those seeking better integration and balance in life.

Manuri Ranasinghe



Indy conducted workshops on laughing yoga and colaborated with sacred sound therapy to bring further healing to students at Soul Fitness LA, yoga studio and the community.  Students loved and saw results from Indy's ongoing workshops.  His work was much appreciated by the community and the students at Soul Fitness LA.

Christian M.



Known Indy for many years and have worked with him a handful of times. Not only is he one of the most intelligent and driven individuals I've ever met, but he leads from a place of love and compassion. Every meeting we've had he makes it a point to give each person in the room an opportunity to share about themselves, including their passion for the project at hand, and what they're highest excitement is within the project, as well as the positive impact the project can have on the world around us. In addition to working together, I've attended a couple of his workshops and each time have left feeling elated and connected not only to the individuals around me but also to myself and my inner child, a relationship Indy helped me to reconnect with and deepen through his presence and dedication to helping others. To any company who is considering working with Indy you are in great hands and I have no doubts you will be moved by his brilliance and kindness.

Kandee Lewis



My company, The Positive Results Corporation engaged @Indy Rishi Singh to teach young ladies the joy of laughter. Indy communicated with me well in advance of his coming to the school, and showed up well before the anticipated time. He was full of joy and engaged in a positive and healthy manner with all (21) of the young ladies. We laughed until our cheeks hurt! The young ladies all enjoyed the time we spent with Indy Rishi! 

Continued success in all you adventures, and blessing of abundance!

Kandee
